title: Kim Kardashian praises Prince Harry and Meghan Markle for bringing attention to important issues
text:
Kim Kardashian knows that nobody is perfect. Not even her, and not even the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

The 38-year-old reality TV superstar is in Armenia this week and was asked by a local reporter about her thoughts on Prince Harry and Meghan Markle — and after drawing similarities between the royal couple and herself, she sang their praises.

'I think that everyone makes their own choices and decisions,' she said. 'And I think that, like I said, no one's gonna be perfect. I'm not, they’re not. I don't know who is.

Thumbs up! Kim Kardashian was asked about her thoughts on Prince Harry and Meghan Markle — and after drawing similarities between the royal couple and herself, she sang their praises

She said: 'I still love and value the fact they bring such attention to such important movements that need to happen and things that they're really passionate about'

Speaking at the Armenia Technology Convention in Yerevan, she went on: 'I still love and value the fact they bring such attention to such important movements that need to happen and things that they're really passionate about.

'They're still changing the world,' she said.

Harry and Meghan certainly champion a few important causes, including mental health awareness.

Most recently, they appeared in a new PSA promoting the NHS's new Every Mind Matters initiative alongside the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge.

Harry is also currently working on a docu-series with Oprah that will be available on Apple TV and focus on ental illness and mental wellness, and aims to inspire viewers to have an honest conversation about the challenges they face.

Traveling: The 38-year-old reality TV superstar is in Armenia this week

New subjects: She shared her thoughts at the Armenia Technology Convention in Yerevan

Candid: Like Harry and Meghan, Kim has spoken out about mental health struggles

Kim, meanwhile, has also spoken out about mental health, particularly in regards to husband Kanye West's bipolar disorder.

She has also opened up about her own issues with depression, and revealed that she sought out the help of a therapist after her traumatic robbery in Paris.

But Kim's path has yet to cross with Harry and Meghan's — though, according to a report last year, that's not for lack of trying.

In late 2018, Radar reported that Kim was planning to send a pricey baby gift to the couple ahead of the birth of Archie.

'The royal baby's a perfect time for her to remind Meghan — and Harry — that she and Kanye are sincere, thoughtful people and she's looking to stand out from all the other celebrities with something truly impressive,' a source said.

'She's been researching everything from diamond baby jewelry to crystal nursery décor and designer onesies.

Real talk: She's talked about her own depression and husband Kanye West's bipolar disorder

Warming up: Last year, she was reportedly planning to buy the couple a pricey baby gift and hoped to become friends with the Duchess

'Kim is convinced she and Meghan will be best friends one day,' the source went on.

'It's very much a long-term project and she's chipping away to impress her when the opportunities arise.'

As far as the public knows, though, Kim still hasn't managed to bridge a connection, despite mutual friends.

In September, Kim sat front row at Serena Williams' New York Fashion Week show. Serena, of course, is a close friend of Meghan's.

Kim and Kanye are also friends with Beyonce and Jay Z, and the latter couple had the chance to meet Prince Harry and Meghan at a Lion King premiere earlier this year.
description: The 38-year-old is visiting Armenia this week. She was asked for her thoughts on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. Kim said said that no one is perfect, including them or herself.
